lines.name: IRA
lines.line: Right. It’s happening. I have got to move this shit around.

lines.name: HEXATE
lines.line: Ira? What are you doing Ira?

lines.name: IRA
lines.line: It’s got to go. This – look. Sick of it.
I just need it to be - not this anymore.

lines.name: HEXATE
lines.line: You seem a little agitated Ira.
Was it the banging of his fist on your door?
[snickering] What do you call a girl who hasn’t slept in days?
That sort of attention seeking won’t help
What do you call a girl who hasn’t slept in days?

lines.name: IRA
lines.line: Easy. I’m so glad your free - no really, I -
I’ve missed you too. Ok, bye!

lines.name: TESS
lines.line: No, ciggie first. That Uber was way too stressful.

lines.name: TESS
lines.line: What was with the thousand questions?
I feel like I should make a complaint-

lines.name: IRA
lines.line: A complaint? It’s 2am, the guy was probably

lines.name: TESS
lines.line: [imitating driver]"What do you get up to for fun?"
"Are you seeing anyone at the moment?"
Come on Ira, you don’t owe that stranger shit
- especially not your damned love life.

lines.name: TESS
lines.line: [addressing audience] Will she ever get wet again?

lines.name: MIA
lines.line: Oh hi, sorry – we tried the front door,
but - I’m a friend of Jane’s.

lines.name: MIA
lines.line: Sorry, she told me she finished at one
I’m Mia by the way, and this is-

lines.name: MIA
lines.line: Would it be cool if we hung here till she got home?

lines.name: MIA
lines.line: Babe do you need some water?
I’ll go grab some, can you roll for me?

lines.name: TESS
lines.line: I’m going to get a jumper.
you don’t have to answer, I’m/
It’s ok, I made it clear after that
I’m not going to take things too seriously anymore.

lines.name: IRA
lines.line: No. I’m… Why do you still see her
– when she hurt you like that?

lines.name: LEE
lines.line: looks like fun. I wish I was brave enough to try

lines.name: IRA
lines.line: Arts. As in, I don’t really know

lines.name: LEE
lines.line: Do any of us really know?

lines.name: TESS
lines.line: Ira the funniest thing just happened -
Are you even trying to conceal your lady boner,

lines.name: IRA
lines.line: SHhh, fuck Tess shut up! What do you-

lines.name: TESS
lines.line: Look I just got texted to work tomorrow,
so I need to leave like now – but –

lines.name: IRA
lines.line: Yes it is. I’ll call you tomorrow?
I left my pouch outside, walk out with me?

lines.name: IRA
lines.line: Sorry – don’t stop on my account!
How is my little fruit blossom today?
I can send more sleeping pills-

lines.name: IRA
lines.line: No, yes- I don’t want the pills.
That is not how I raised you.
be that bright little shining star
I know I raised you to be.
relaxed? you did sleep well then?

lines.name: IRA
lines.line: I just… did it. Felt it, and did it.
I felt like an idiot, first.
It’s been so long… but, it felt good.

lines.name: PSYCH
lines.line: That’s great Ira! You’re listening to your body.
Sometimes we forget that our body has wants,
regardless of the way your brain

lines.name: PSYCH
lines.line: So, you slept through the night,

lines.name: IRA
lines.line: Actually, I didn’t get a great sleep, before…
Honestly I think I only had the energy to –

lines.name: PSYCH
lines.line: Your dreams. Which was it this time?
It’s like the sludge pouring one with mum, and -
but instead it had… her, and – him.

lines.name: IRA
lines.line: We were – the chick, and I,
passionately. Then I start to feel him. His –
its small, at first, but it starts to build.
Not as in – like, that climax…
He’s not only pulling at me,
and together we try to run.

lines.name: IRA
lines.line: I can taste his breath, smell his
greasy stink, like it’s the sludge
His arms are slapping my back with
it starts to feel like we can’t move.
I can hear him and feel this sludge
like body sweat lathering over me,
and I’m pulling, pushing away but
we can’t get loose – and then
this. Still stuck, but watching her –
in the muck – pulling away from me,
arm, reaching from the mud and
"let her go, don’t touch her, stop!"
seem to keep popping up in our sessions –
You mentioned, you thought you saw him recently?

lines.name: IRA
lines.line: I was walking down the street.
Some dirty old man cat called me -
It can’t have been him, but it was.

lines.name: PSYCH
lines.line: How did it feel? When you thought you saw him?

lines.name: PSYCH
lines.line: The reason I ask, is that the dreams -
all seem to suggest your experience
of this person was quite traumatic.
These are some symptoms of a
but there are a range of therapies

lines.name: IRA
lines.line: I don’t need to be medicated.
that’s between you and your GP.

lines.name: IRA
lines.line: He’s just going to prescribe me
These emotions and memories can be
Make an appointment with your GP.
he can talk you through the available options.
Yeah where are you, come outside?

lines.name: LEE
lines.line: Yeah, good, this place is sick!
Or at least my drugs are working

lines.name: IRA
lines.line: A little MD, I can’t do too much ‘cos…

lines.name: LEE
lines.line: Hey no shame, no game, no pain babe!

lines.name: IRA
lines.line: My friends coming out from the D-floor now
I saw you looking at me.
Do you want to kiss me?
I’d like to see you again. Let me know.
Can’t flake on me like you did last night,
and the come down is on!

lines.name: TESS
lines.line: When was the last time you saw your floor?
Why is all your furniture – everywhere?

lines.name: IRA
lines.line: I got bored the other night.

lines.name: TESS
lines.line: after you ditched me at the smokers
I ended up going home with this weirdo,
who happens to live around the corner from you.
If I didn’t know you, Ira,
I’d have to admit it kinda smells

lines.name: TESS
lines.line: Really? I had a great time.
Oh my god, I nearly forgot –
guess who I talked to last night!
Seriously though, you’ll want to hear this…
She’s always got some ridiculous story about

lines.name: IRA
lines.line: I should probably just tell her that
but I can’t see that stopping her.

lines.name: TESS
lines.line: He’s dating some sixteen year-old or something,
super rough, I mean what’s that,

lines.name: TESS
lines.line: Yeah, whatever, but Bec told me she’s some-
still hung up on him are you?
Of course I’m not hung up on him

lines.name: TESS
lines.line: Ira, I know it was hard,

lines.name: IRA
lines.line: Exactly, Tess it’s been two years.

lines.name: TESS
lines.line: So , you should be able to talk
you walked into my house and woke me up,
and you’re now bringing him back
into my life with this bullshit gossip!

lines.name: TESS
lines.line: Ira, calm down I didn’t mean to-
I can’t do this. You need to leave.

lines.name: TESS
lines.line: Who the fuck are you, Ira?
what will you do with this?
I’m not actually bothered by this at all.
I mean I don’t give a shit
who he sticks it in these days….
I deleted him on my birthday.
He sent me this super pass-ag message,
something like "I know you’re happier without me
and probably won’t have the courtesy to reply,
I responded, purely to rub my freedom
in his face with an overly courteous:
"thanks so much! It's been wonderful already!".
She looks like me, kind of.
I mean there are no photos of them
together so I can’t be sure but…

lines.name: IRA
lines.line: I mean I wouldn’t wish that on her,
why does she look so god damn
This photo - she’s with some other guy...
my bitches photo you twelvie dog,
she doesn’t talk to no other dudes".
"Yeah cool dude, she does when you're
I – love heart – you baby, and
I’ve deleted this child from my friends.
Love heart - nobody calls you a loser.
He ‘holds her down’ in public too, I guess.
To sort out other people’s shit.
but, she’s in love, I bet.
I mean so was I. I had to deal with it.
I was 16, I’m still here, I could’ve said no.
I didn’t know that then, but I could’ve.
Well what, a girl gets raped every day
it’s called natural selection by the patriarchy
'awareness' about it now that she can deal with it.
I mean we’ve all got to learn to deal
with our own problems so why don’t you all just
Some other protagonist with a little
less angst to roll on in?
A clear plot line to emerge?

lines.name: DR BUNT
lines.line: So, you think you have PTSD?
Dr Adams suggested I may be showing symptoms-

lines.name: IRA
lines.line: I mean, I’ve had bad dreams before-

lines.name: DR BUNT
lines.line: Right. And this voice in your head

lines.name: DR BUNT
lines.line: Have you used any recreational drugs since then?

lines.name: DR BUNT
lines.line: Hm. By the sounds of things,
your lack of sleep over the last two years
is contributing to some sort of hallucination -
this could also be contributing to your anxiety

lines.name: IRA
lines.line: They aren’t just random voices in my head -
things he used to say to me-

lines.name: DR BUNT
lines.line: Regardless of who the voices are…
I think it’s probably best we start treating them.
I’d like to start you on Olanzapine –
and subdues the effect of psychosis.

lines.name: IRA
lines.line: I am not getting hooked on some drug, I don’t need-
This is normal given your current state,
but you need to remain calm.
you can still live a normal life.
Medicating at this point may be your best bet
At the very least, you will sleep.

lines.name: IRA
lines.line: I didn’t fill the prescription, if that’s what you’re wondering. There are no protagonists yet to emerge. My room is still a mess; my relationships are waiting to miraculously appear… </br></br>But, I slept a full eight hours last night. </br></br>I talked to some random guy on the tram after seeing Dr Bunt. I told him everything. Poor guy, probably didn’t expect a summary of my last three years with a "hey, are you ok?".</br></br>I told him about her.</br></br>That I can’t help but feel like it’s my fault if anything happens to her. </br></br>Because I never reported anything. He told me I shouldn’t hold onto my guilt, and that if I was really worried, I should contact her. I couldn’t stop thinking, what if I do - and she tells him, and it comes back to me and suddenly he really is standing in front of me, accusing me of accusing him of... </br></br>Doing what he did.</br></br>I messaged her last night. I don’t know if she’ll reply. But I feel more awake now. I’m ready, if she does.
